newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: KLM plans selected 5-10pct cargo rate rises.
newsitem.headline: KLM plans selected 5-10pct cargo rate rises.

text.p: KLM Royal Dutch Airlines NV's cargo division is planning to introduce rate increases of bewteen 5 to 10 percent on certain routes during the first quarter of 1997, an airline spokesman said.
In a telephone interview with Reuters, spokesman Peter Wellhuener said he could not specify which routes would be involved or say precisely when the increases will come.

He added KLM's policy of negotiating individual tariffs and deals with its shipper customers remains in place, but that the airline is letting the market know its plan for the early part of next year.

"We're giving the message that in times to come - specifically in the first quarter of 1997 - we will increase our rates. The level of the increase and the timing depends on routes and specific market situations", Wellhuener said.
He added that KLM is seeking to rebalance rates which fell during the first half of 1996. --Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax +44 171 542 5017
